column1: #: description: Acceptance for $\tilde{\mu}$ of various masses and lifetimes in SR-$\mu\mu$. Acceptance is defined as the number of accepted events at generator level in signal Monte Carlo simulation divided by the total number of events in the sample. To be accepted
column2: events are required to have at least 2 truth muons with $p_\text{T} > 65$ GeV
column5: and $\Delta R_{\ell\ell} > 0.2$. Events are also required to fall into one of the acceptance regions of the triggers used. At generator level
column6: events must have one of the following: one electron with $p_\text{T} >$ 160 GeV

column1: #: keyword observables: SUSY | Supersymmetry | Proton-Proton Scattering | Electroweak | R-parity violating
#: keyword reactions: P P --> SLEPTON SLEPTON
